description.narrative: Programmet består av tre delar: 1) ett mastersprogram eller alternativt en specialisering inom samhällsvetenskap för social utveckling med fokus på rurala regioner; 2) forskning om fattigas inkomst (dess karaktär, hur den kan höjas och vilka effekter det kan ha för individerna samt för landet); samt skapa offentlig debatt kring ämnet; och 3) ett stöd till institutionen.

The programme consists of three parts: 1) A masters programme or alternatively a specialisation in social management of human and social development with focus on rural regions; 2) research on the income for the poor (how to increase the income and what effects an increase can have on the families and also on a national level) and promote a public debate on the issue; 3) and institutional support.

participating-org.narrative: FLASCO/Latin American Faculty of Social Sciences

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: Results of the intervention have been only partially achieved, with main efforts and focus placed on the Masters Program, which provided access to higher education for the target group (indigenous rural, mayan population, mainly women). A total of 17 Masters Degrees in Rural Development were awarded as a direct result of the intervention. The other objectives of the intervention were only partially achieved. New knowledge based on academic investigation on income generation and its impact on the poor was only marginally generated and it was not debated as a result of the intervention. 8 out of 17 Masters Thesis dealt with economic development and income generation in some form or the other. An International Seminar on "Iniciativas en la generacion de ingresos sostenibles para pobres y su incidencia en el desarrollo social" was held in July 2015. The role of FLACSO as opinion former and producer of relevant knowledge for public debate and policy formation was not strengthened as a result of the intervention. Implementation of the intervention was slow and inefficient, and FLACSO prioritized its academic programs and publication of study papers. In retrospect, it appears that the donor and the partner did not share the same vision or priorities for the intervention, resulting in only partial achievement of results. Market and feasibility studies were conducted as part of institutional strengthening of FLACSO. There is no evidence how FLACSO has implemented the results of these studies. Results register has been updated based on the Final Report. For information 2014 please see the prior handover prepared by Lena Strandberg dated 2015-04-28.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
